item.title: Apple says it'll remove iMessage & FaceTime in UK rather than break encryption
item.description: - The article discusses the possibility of Apple discontinuing the "S" model of the iPhone and whether or not we will see another version in the future.

item.title: FedNow Is Live
item.description: - The Federal Reserve has launched a new system called the FedNow Service that allows banks and credit unions to instantly transfer money for their customers.

item.title: No-more-secrets: recreate the decryption effect seen in the 1992 movie Sneakers
item.description: - The project "No More Secrets" is a command line tool that recreates the famous data decryption effect seen in the 1992 hacker movie Sneakers.

item.title: Docuseal: Open-source DocuSign alternative
item.description: - DocuSeal is an open-source platform for digital document signing and processing.

item.title: Fly.io Postgres cluster down for 3 days, no word from them about it
item.description: - The Fly.io Postgres cluster experienced a service interruption for 3 days, causing machines to become unresponsive and unable to restart or be destroyed.

item.title: TypeChat
item.description: - TypeChat is an experimental library that aims to integrate large language models into existing app interfaces by using type definitions to retrieve structured AI responses.

item.title: The past is not true
item.description: - The author shares a personal story about a past accident and how it affected both their and the other driver's perspective.

item.title: Accidentally Load Bearing
item.description: - Understanding the original purpose and current role of a system or component is crucial when making changes to complex computer systems.

item.title: IRS moves forward with a new free-file tax return system
item.description: - The IRS is implementing a new system called free-file tax return, which allows taxpayers to file their tax returns for free through selected online platforms.

item.title: Anytype â€“ local-first, P2P Notion alternative
item.description: - "Anytype" is a new software that works like a popular app called Notion.
